alert.note: Alert for Creek; Osage; Rogers; Tulsa; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 12:48PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm winds will impact portions of Rogers, southeastern Osage, northeastern Creek, western Mayes, northwestern Wagoner and northeastern Tulsa Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1247 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated outflow winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Foyil to 6 miles west of Skiatook. Movement was south at 35 mph. These winds will be in advance of strong thunderstorms which will also move south into the area through 130 PM. HAZARD...Wind gusts 40 to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Tulsa... Broken Arrow... Sand Springs... Claremore... Owasso... Jenks... Pryor Creek... Skiatook... Catoosa... Collinsville... Verdigris... Chouteau... Inola... Sperry... Foyil... Jenks Riverside Airport... Turley... Tulsa International Airport... Taiwah... Tiawah... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 212 and 266. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
